stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Pleasantly Surprised Themed Phishing Email
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 12 January 2015, a government department was targeted with a phishing email sent with the subject "Pleasantly surprised". The email included the malicious attachment Pleasantly surprised.zip (MD5: 10BB31EE7971062D9DC730719266A22B), which contained the Gh0st remote administration tool (RAT). The Gh0st RAT called back to www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com.
Similar activity was previously described most recently in IB-15-10071.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
--- BEGIN EMAIL HEADER--- Received: from omr-m03.mx.aol.com (omr-m03.mx.aol.com [64.12.143.77]) (using TLSv1 with cipher ADH-AES256-SHA (256/256 bits)) (No client certificate requested)\ by oms-m03.mx.aol.com (AOL Outbound OMS Interface) with ESMTPS id 3EFD338001E3D for <REDACTED>; Mon, 12 Jan 2015 11:43:42 -0500 (EST) Received: from mtaomg-mca02.mx.aol.com (mtaomg-mca02.mx.aol.com [172.26.221.80]) by omr-m03.mx.aol.com (Outbound Mail Relay) with ESMTP id 086E6700370B6; Mon, 12 Jan 2015 11:43:40 -0500 (EST) Received: from core-mpa01h.mail.aol.com (core-mpa01.mail.aol.com [172.27.32.11]) by mtaomg-mca02.mx.aol.com (OMAG/Core Interface) with ESMTP id 7754238000086; Mon, 12 Jan 2015 11:43:38 -0500 (EST) Received: from 174.139.86.74 by webprd-m06.mail.aol.com (10.74.6.158) with HTTP (WebMailUI); 2015-Jan-12 16:43:38 Date: Mon, 12 Jan 2015 11:43:38 -0500 From: <[REDACTED]> To:<[REDACTED]> Message-Id: <14adf077ee0-d40-5868@webprd-m06.mail.aol.com> Subject: Pleasantly surprised MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----=_Part_25758_386323888.1421081018078" X-MB-Message-Source: WebUI X-MB-Message-Type: User X-Mailer: JAS STD X-Originating-IP: [174.139.86.74] x-aol-global-disposition: S X-SPAM-FLAG: YES X-AOL-VSS-INFO: 5600.1067/98281 X-AOL-VSS-CODE: clean DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=mx.aol.com; s=20140625; t=1421081019; bh=vnUyPhY/OyvJW5nY1l4RKd6S4WkAOfyf0HgfDE5cYyI=; h=From:To:Subject:Message-Id:Date:MIME-Version:Content-Type; b=JsdvRWddp6sYWKwO5ZlN2pnN2bPBiWKiqyy1R92h8ZhsFYT8AOSEdZDqyx2FYXK4j h/m4QspnlBo/GhxsCk8c/0lt/GRQDAIwbKkswCXsHAD1a8ilCrMMUSHDop84KFhf6p 8AAPhWssMm3HBf7mfRIBJuSH8SDeWUbhcwzFTn0M= X-AOL-REROUTE: YES x-aol-sid: 3039ac1add5054b3f9ba0b71
Subject: Pleasantly surprised From: <[REDACTED]> To:<[REDACTED]>; Mon Jan 12 16:43:38 GMT 2015 Attachments: Pleasantly surprised.zip (375916 bytes); --- END EMAIL HEADER---
The attachment is a zip file archive.

The executable file displayed a pixelated "Play Button" icon. When executed, it created a hidden folder C:\Recycle09102014 and created the Gh0st RAT implant DLL "GameUpdate.log". The executable file, also modified the system registry with the implant parameters, executed the newly created DLL, modified the System Registry for persistence of the DLL, executed clean-up commands to delete itself, and then terminated itself.
The following command was issued to execute the DLL: RUNDLL32.EXE C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log,LoaderEntry
The following command was issued to delete itself: cmd /c ping 127.0.0.1 -n 1&del "C:\Documents and Settings\User\Desktop\Pleasantly surprised.Exe"
The following changes were made to the system: File added: C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log File deleted: C:\Documents and Settings\User\Desktop\Pleasantly surprised.Exe (Deleted itself) Folder added: C:\Recycle09102014
The following registry values were added: HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\GameInit: 52 55 4E 44 4C 4C 33 32 2E 45 58 45 20 43 3A 5C 52 65 63 79 63 6C 65 30 39 31 30 32 30 31 34 5C 47 61 6D 65 55 70 64 61 74 65 2E 6C 6F 67 2C 4C 6F 61 64 65 72 45 6E 74 72 79 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: "PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Services\BITS\LoginPort: "zECcKg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: "PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg==" HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginPort: "zECcKg==" Decoded Hex Value: Run\GameInit: RUNDLL32.EXE C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log,LoaderEntry Decoded Base64 Values: BITS\LoginAddress: 00000000 3c 85 de 05 98 ec 41 c4 e8 45 97 e0 49 da f4 41 <.....A. .E..I..A 00000010 c5 e8 45 95 a7 48 9a e4 2a ..E..H.. * BITS\LoginPort: 00000000 cc 40 9c 2a .@.*

When the Gh0st RAT implant DLL was executed, it loaded the implant configuration parameters from the system registry, then began to communicate on the network. If the victim types on the keyboard, a key logger file 'C:\WINDOWS\system32\ky1log.dat' is created.
Command issued to execute DLL: RUNDLL32.EXE C:\Recycle09102014\GameUpdate.log,LoaderEntry
Registry Values read: HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginAddress: PIXeBZjsQcToRZfgSdr0QcXoRZWnSJrkKg== HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\BITS\LoginPort: zECcKg==
The following network traffic occurred: DNS Request (port 53): www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com TCP connection www.meitanjiaoyiwang.com port 705: 00000000 83 00 00 00 e0 00 00 00 41 53 44 46 47 78 9c 4b ........ ASDFGx.K 00000010 93 5a 59 38 87 81 81 81 15 88 19 81 58 83 8b 81 .ZY8.... ....X... 00000020 81 09 48 07 a7 16 95 65 26 a7 2a 04 24 26 67 2b ..H....e &.*.$&g+ 00000030 18 31 30 08 30 a0 01 05 28 86 ea 7b c9 cc c0 90 .10.0... (..{.... 00000040 06 d4 29 c3 60 01 d6 bf 06 48 28 b0 31 30 f0 1a ..).`... .H(.10.. 00000050 31 c2 b5 30 32 20 d8 77 a0 6a 1e 30 83 ec 63 e1 1..02 .w .j.0..c. 00000060 86 89 fb c4 ad 06 f2 99 0e 32 81 35 30 32 6c 04 ........ .2.502l. 00000070 ca ac 11 48 8e 48 cd 4d cd 41 77 02 31 00 00 ed ...H.H.M .Aw.1... 00000080 3f 12 b6 ?.. 131 bytes
The traffic continued approximately every 10 seconds. The following changes were made to the system: File created: C:\WINDOWS\system32\ky1log.dat File: ky1log.dat Size: 49 bytes MD5: EF52ABC854163B4DBEE33F4EA147FB33 This file is an obfuscated key logger file. The MD5 will be unique to each instance.
The file GameUpdate.log (MD5 91E636CCCE5FC5E9DA25DF7EA5C80900) performs a DNS request. Communications to this Command and Control (C2) domain were observed over port 705.
